metadata.name: DIM_EVM_EVENT_ABIS
metadata.comment: This table contains the individual event abis for each all contracts that we have ABIs for. Proxies are rolled up to their implementation.

BLOCKCHAIN.name: BLOCKCHAIN
BLOCKCHAIN.comment: The blockchain that the event abi is for.

PARENT_CONTRACT_ADDRESS.name: PARENT_CONTRACT_ADDRESS
PARENT_CONTRACT_ADDRESS.comment: The address of the contract that the event abi is for.

SIMPLE_EVENT_NAME.name: SIMPLE_EVENT_NAME
SIMPLE_EVENT_NAME.comment: The name of the event along with its parameters.

EVENT_SIGNATURE.name: EVENT_SIGNATURE
EVENT_SIGNATURE.comment: The keccak256 signature of the simple event name. This can be used to filter for events in the logs table on topics[0].

START_BLOCK.name: START_BLOCK
START_BLOCK.comment: The block number of the creation of the contract containing the event. This could be from a proxy or an implementation.

END_BLOCK.name: END_BLOCK
END_BLOCK.comment: The block number before a similar event was created in the contract. This could be from a proxy or an implementation.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

DIM_EVM_EVENT_ABIS_ID.name: DIM_EVM_EVENT_ABIS_ID
DIM_EVM_EVENT_ABIS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: DIM_CONTRACTS
metadata.comment: This table contains contract details for contracts deployed on the Ethereum, Optimism, Polygon, BSC, Arbitrum, Avalanche, Osmosis and Solana blockchains.

ADDRESS.name: ADDRESS
ADDRESS.comment: The unique address of the deployed contract.

SYMBOL.name: SYMBOL
SYMBOL.comment: The symbol used to represent this contract. Please note this is not necessarily unique.

NAME.name: NAME
NAME.comment: The name of the deployed contract. Please note this is not necessarily unique.

DECIMALS.name: DECIMALS
DECIMALS.comment: The number of decimal places this contract needs adjusted where token values exist.

BLOCKCHAIN.name: BLOCKCHAIN
BLOCKCHAIN.comment: The corresponding blockchain for contract details.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

DIM_CONTRACTS_ID.name: DIM_CONTRACTS_ID
DIM_CONTRACTS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: DIM_DATE_HOURS
metadata.comment: Hold rows for each hour from 2017 to current timestamp (UTC)

DATE_HOUR.name: DATE_HOUR
DATE_HOUR.comment: Specific hour of a given date

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: EZ_DECODED_EVENT_LOGS
metadata.comment:
'For information on how to submit a contract for decoding, as well as how ABIs are sourced, please visit [here](https://science.flipsidecrypto.xyz/abi-requestor/). This model contains decoded event logs for contracts that we have an ABI for. Please note, this table does not include all event logs, only those that we have an ABI for. The `decoded_log` column is the easiest place to query decoded data. It is a JSON object, where the keys are the names of the event parameters, and the values are the values of the event parameters. You can select from this column using the following sample format, `decoded_log:from::string` or more generally, `decoded_log:<event_param>::datatype`. See below for a full sample query. The `full_decoded_logs` column contains the same information, as well as additional fields such as the datatype of the decoded data. You may need to laterally flatten this column to query the data.
      
Sample query for USDC Transfer events:
```sql select  tx_hash, block_number, contract_address, decoded_log:from::string as from_address, decoded_log:to::string as to_address, decoded_log:value::integer as value from ethereum.core.fact_decoded_event_logs where contract_address = lower('0xA0b86991c6218b36c1d19D4a2e9Eb0cE3606eB48') and block_number between 16400000 and 16405000 and event_name = 'Transfer' limit 50```'

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.

CONTRACT_ADDRESS.name: CONTRACT_ADDRESS
CONTRACT_ADDRESS.comment: The address interacted with for a given event.

TOPIC_0.name: TOPIC_0
TOPIC_0.comment: The first topic of the event, which is a unique identifier for the event.

TOPIC_1.name: TOPIC_1
TOPIC_1.comment: The second topic of the event, if applicable.

TOPIC_2.name: TOPIC_2
TOPIC_2.comment: The third topic of the event, if applicable.

TOPIC_3.name: TOPIC_3
TOPIC_3.comment: The fourth topic of the event, if applicable.

EVENT_REMOVED.name: EVENT_REMOVED
EVENT_REMOVED.comment: Whether the event has been removed from the transaction.

ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The from address at the transaction level.

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The to address at the transaction level.

ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.name: ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.comment: The function signature of the contract call.

EVENT_NAME.name: EVENT_NAME
EVENT_NAME.comment: The name of the event, as defined in the contract ABI.

FULL_DECODED_LOG.name: FULL_DECODED_LOG
FULL_DECODED_LOG.comment: The full decoded log, including the event name, the event parameters, and the data type of the event parameters.

DECODED_LOG.name: DECODED_LOG
DECODED_LOG.comment: The flattened decoded log, where the keys are the names of the event parameters, and the values are the values of the event parameters.

CONTRACT_NAME.name: CONTRACT_NAME
CONTRACT_NAME.comment: The name of the contract, if the contract has a name() function.

EZ_DECODED_EVENT_LOGS_ID.name: EZ_DECODED_EVENT_LOGS_ID
EZ_DECODED_EVENT_LOGS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

TX_STATUS.name: TX_STATUS
TX_STATUS.comment: This column is being deprecated for standardization purposes. Please update your queries by March 10, 2025.

bytes.label: Approximate Size
bytes.description: Approximate size of the table as reported by Snowflake

row_count.label: Row Count
row_count.description: An approximate count of rows in this table

clustering_key.label: Clustering Key
clustering_key.description: The key used to cluster this table

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: FACT_EVENT_LOGS
metadata.comment: This table contains flattened event logs from transactions on this EVM blockchain. Transactions may have multiple events, which are denoted by the event index for a transaction hash. Therefore, this table is unique on the combination of transaction hash and event index. Please see `fact_decoded_event_logs` or `ez_decoded_event_logs` for the decoded event logs.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.

CONTRACT_ADDRESS.name: CONTRACT_ADDRESS
CONTRACT_ADDRESS.comment: The address interacted with for a given event.

TOPIC_0.name: TOPIC_0
TOPIC_0.comment: The first topic of the event, which is a unique identifier for the event.

TOPIC_1.name: TOPIC_1
TOPIC_1.comment: The second topic of the event, if applicable.

TOPIC_2.name: TOPIC_2
TOPIC_2.comment: The third topic of the event, if applicable.

TOPIC_3.name: TOPIC_3
TOPIC_3.comment: The fourth topic of the event, if applicable.

EVENT_REMOVED.name: EVENT_REMOVED
EVENT_REMOVED.comment: Whether the event has been removed from the transaction.

ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The from address at the transaction level.

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The to address at the transaction level.

ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.name: ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.comment: The function signature of this transaction.

TX_SUCCEEDED.name: TX_SUCCEEDED
TX_SUCCEEDED.comment: Whether the transaction was successful, returned as a boolean.

FACT_EVENT_LOGS_ID.name: FACT_EVENT_LOGS_ID
FACT_EVENT_LOGS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The UTC timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The UTC timestamp at which the row was last modified.

TX_STATUS.name: TX_STATUS
TX_STATUS.comment: This column is being deprecated for standardization purposes. Please update your queries to use the `tx_succeeded` column instead by March 10, 2025.

_LOG_ID.name: _LOG_ID
_LOG_ID.comment: This column is being removed for standardization purposes. Please remove or update your queries with `CONCAT(tx_hash, '_', event_index)` to reconstruct `_log_id` by March 10, 2025.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table
